segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the type and function of the message and to transmit its identifying number.
DTM, A segment to specify the date and, when required, the time at which the message has been created as well as specification of other process dates.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to give auxiliary references and the relevant dates for the message itself.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to give another reference for the message.
DTM, A segment to give the period reported in the message (for example day/month/year).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to give the identification of the reporting agent (generally the enterprise) or, possibly with a second occurrence, the identification of the enterprise on behalf of which the declaration is made.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the resident party.
CTA, A segment to identify a person or a department for the party specified in the NAD segment and to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment to give a communication number for the party identified in the NAD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to accommodate the details corresponding with one credit advice received during the relevant period.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the report line item by a current line number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to give references and dates of the corresponding CREADV message (to be extracted from the CREADV message header).

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to give the serial number of the received CREADV message.
DTM, A segment to give the day, month & year of the CREADV message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to give the nature of the transaction, the amount and geographical detail. If the payment relates to different transactions or consists of composite payments each transaction has to be specified by its nature, its amount and, if necessary its geographical detail.

segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to give the nature of each transaction.
FTX, A segment to give information in clear and free form about the nature of each transaction.
MOA, A segment to give the amount and the currency of each transaction.
LOC, A segment to indicate one of the different countries involved in each transaction.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to specify the details of authentication.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment to specify the details of any authentication (validation) procedure applied to the BOPINF message.
DTM, A segment identifying the validation date/time.
